alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Mower; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 12:10AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Thunderstorms may bring hail overnight... Shortly after midnight clusters of growing thunderstorms were moving across southern Minnesota, not too far from the Albert Lea area. These storms may increase in strength over the next hour or two producing hail. HAZARD...Up to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hayfield around 1245 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Eden, Highway 57 And 570th Street, County Roads 6 And 15, Hidden Meadows R V Park, Rock Dell, Brookside Campground, County Roads 5 And 6, Mayville, Rochester Airport, and Graves Landing Field. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 175 and 212. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
